intro: Thymbra ambigua, commonly known as the Mediterranean thyme, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic plants known for their essential oils. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with small, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are usually pink or white, arranged in compact clusters at the ends of the stems. Thymbra ambigua is valued for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional medicine and as a culinary herb.
